quest.name: Out on Patrol
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Olmet is preparing for a patrol of the ruins.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: Ah, your timing is quite fortuitous. I have a task that could make use of one with your expertise.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: Since beginning our vigil after the fall of Ronka, we Viis have seldom ventured beyond the bounds of Yx'Maja.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: But times are changing, and it has come to our attention that the ruins beneath Lake Tusi Mek'ta remain untouched by the Blessed.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: Being more familiar with the environs of the west, I think you would be well suited to the endeavor.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: According to our records, there are several owl statues somewhere within the ruins. I ask that you find them and ensure they yet remain whole.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: You are familiar with Lake Tusi Mek'ta, yes? Then this survey should prove no trouble at all.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03474
dialogue.text: You find nothing out of the ordinary.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03474
dialogue.text: The beak of the owl statue appears to be chipped.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03474
dialogue.text: The statue appears to be covered in algae. You gingerly wipe it away.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: You wiped them as well? I'd expect nothing less from an ally of Ronka, and a fellow Viis at that.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: You wiped them as well? I'd expect nothing less from an ally of Ronka.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: In the days of the Ronkan Empire, the owl was regarded with great reverence. The divine beast of night and keeper of knowledge.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: In fact, there is a legend that speaks of a time when darkness fades and the people pray for night. An owl is said to guide shehe who heralds the night's return.

dialogue.name: OLMET
dialogue.text: Perhaps that is why fate brings you here.
